intro: Cormigonus deplanchei, commonly known as the desert corm, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its underground corm, which serves as a storage organ for nutrients. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and yellow, often blooming in spring. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Cormigonus deplanchei is well-suited to harsh environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert plains.
